New Records: Sri Lanka were skittled for their lowest T20 score of 77.
Key Match Events: South Africa beat Sri Lanka by six wickets.
Ottniel Baartman took a wicket with his first ball at a World Cup and picked up 1 for 9 from four overs.
Anrich Nortje finished with remarkable figures of 4-0-7-4.
South Africa's star performers were Ottniel Baartman and Anrich Nortje.
South Africa won comfortably with 22 balls to spare.
Sri Lanka's top seven were trampled by Anrich Nortje.
South Africa's hitters played within themselves even when they were chasing just 78.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka captain Wanindu Hasaranga mentioned they were looking for a score of 160-170 but realized it was a 120-130 wicket.
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram expressed happiness with the win and mentioned the tough wicket.
Markram praised Anrich Nortje's performance and confidence boost.
Sri Lanka captain Wanindu Hasaranga reflected on the team's performance and the need to do better as a batting unit.
Player of the match Anrich Nortje expressed happiness with his performance and the team's effort to restrict Sri Lanka to 77.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch in New York was very tough, making it a challenging game.
South Africa's batting depth will be a concern going forward.
Sri Lanka should consider including Madhushanka in the playing 11.
The New York pitch is doing a lot more than a typical T20 surface, making for intriguing cricket during the World Cup.
